title: Drawing, "Project for the Painted Decoration of a Wall, with Alternate Suggestions", 1835–50
medium: Brush and watercolors and graphite on white wove paper; incised lines
inscribed:
In graphite in bottom margin: "NFL Cabineth." 
Verso: in graphite: "Grien" (?), and at the bottom two lines which have been erased. Intelligible: "Hart....? Zimmer grau grass Rosetten / ...mit grüner Bordure."
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Mary Hearn Greims
description: A dado is at the bottom, an entablature on top. The lower part of the design suggests horizontal rows of petal discs, with petals and palmettes in the wedges, for the panel. The upper part suggests alternate and staggered rows of naturalized fleur-de-lis leaves. Framing similar to 1940-120-9.

exhibitions.title: Multiple Choice: From Sample to Product

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Project for the Painted Decoration of a Wall, with Alternate Suggestions", 1835–50.
1835–50. Brush and watercolors and graphite on white wove paper; incised lines. Museum purchase through gift of Mary Hearn Greims. 1940-120-59.
